column2: Vericel Corp. engages in the research, product development, manufacture, and distribution of patient-specific, expanded cellular therapies for use in the treatment of patients with diseases. The company is headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts and currently employs 216 full-time employees. The firm operates through the research, product development, manufacture and distribution of cellular therapies for use in the treatment of specific diseases.. Its autologous cell therapy products include Epicel (cultured epidermal autografts), which is a permanent skin replacement for the treatment of patients with deep-dermal or full-thickness burns. The firm is developing MACI, which is a third-generation autologous chondrocyte implant and ixmyelocel-T, which is a patient-specific multicellular therapy.
